Articles.Content:
So yesterday I went to the HK Science Museum, and they have an entire formerly flight-worthhy DC-3 hung in there. So I dug this old craft out of my backed up save, and furnished it.

Download [https://www.dropbox.com/s/j7lbl4l287jy7w0/DC%203.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/j7lbl4l287jy7w0/DC%203.craft?dl=0)

[![screenshot1104_zpsd12rofjb.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot1104_zpsd12rofjb.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot1104_zpsd12rofjb.png.html)

[![screenshot1111_zpsafvtid7r.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot1111_zpsafvtid7r.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot1111_zpsafvtid7r.png.html)

[![screenshot1117_zpsfsyyknqv.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot1117_zpsfsyyknqv.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot1117_zpsfsyyknqv.png.html)

Comes with a loading ramp.

[![screenshot1120_zpsau1ehdyr.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot1120_zpsau1ehdyr.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot1120_zpsau1ehdyr.png.html)

I like old prop planes! But ... Don't see any propellers on yours!

I challenge you to build a plane, using a single mod (KAX), to rival these two:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/LodwU)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/0JUtK)

Surely you can beat these two :-)

Let's see ... what haven't I see here yet ... 

Aha! Lockheed Constellation!

> 
> I like old prop planes! But ... Don't see any propellers on yours!
> I challenge you to build a plane, using a single mod (KAX), to rival these two:

Wow Azimech those are beautiful!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T17:20:56Z" title="08/02/2015 05:20  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by Majorjim**

> 
> I like old prop planes! But ... Don't see any propellers on yours!
> I challenge you to build a plane, using a single mod (KAX), to rival these two:
> 
> [http://imgur.com/a/LodwU](http://imgur.com/a/LodwU)

Challenge accepted.

Also a Lockheed Connie? Sure.

Hey guys, I managed to make a small rotating prop that can fit on the DC3, but it isin't functional, just pretty.

[![screenshot1891_zps4k8uahjv.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot1891_zps4k8uahjv.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot1891_zps4k8uahjv.png.html)

> 
> Hey guys, I managed to make a small rotating prop that can fit on the DC3, but it isin't functional, just pretty.
> http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot1891_zps4k8uahjv.png.html[http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot1891_zps4k8uahjv.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot1891_zps4k8uahjv.png)

Reaction wheels in a tewb? 

 How did sgt\_flyer do his, I forgot.

Jup, just the old reaction wheel trick, sgt\_flyer did his in a fairing IIRC.

I don't really like how the fairings function now.

> 
> Jup, just the old reaction wheel trick, sgt\_flyer did his in a fairing IIRC.
> I don't really like how the fairings function now.

Yeah the stock fairings are horrid. So do you spin the props up before launch? I guess that is kind of realistic. Kinda like individually starting the engines.
Yeah I do. Also I might build even more crafts with this pseudo prop engine. Time for some WW2 love.
